@piloth The functionality of your site could be reduced to a 1.2MB uncompressed and less than 400KB compressed, using ZIP. The only thing you need is .html, .js, .json (for ZeroNet config), and .css (for styling)

EDIT: My client by default only downloads extensions that can be translated to the `text/*` mimetype (so `.html`, `.txt` etc.), `.js` and `.json` and your site works fine here.
@piloth Removing the `logos/` and `wallets/` folders and re-signing the website will do.
Later you can add tiny icons for the cryptocurrencies. Maybe 16x16 or 32x32 pixel icons.

@piloth Oh, okay. Then keep the `wallets/` folder for now. Just remove the non-essential images.

Edit: Hm, the `wallets/` folder does seem pretty big, I'll try to see how that can be made smaller...

You can also make the `wallets/` folder optional by adding (to your content.json file):

```
"optional": "wallets/.*"
```

Which is a better idea, since then the user won't be forced to download all wallet template files (which are 200KB each)

@piloth Yeah.

@piloth Oh, and having a single wallet template is simple just pick one template you like, call it "template.png" or something, and change this line:

`var walletBackgroundUrl = "wallets/" + janin.selectedCurrency.name.toLowerCase() + ".png";`

To:

`var walletBackgroundUrl = "wallets/template.png";`

In:

`src/ninja.paperwallet.js`

Voila, you just cut 110MB of your site (after removing the redundant wallet templates and adding the smaller logos that is), also do not forget to remove the "optional" statement, since your site is <3MB now.
